etymology.description: 𠈌(𠈌) (sǎn, “umbrella”) originally depicted four people under a canopy -> simplified by replacing 𠈌 with 丷(丷, “eight”) -> 伞(伞) (sǎn, “umbrella”)
etymology.interpretation: The character 伞(伞) (sǎn, “umbrella”) simplifies 傘(傘) by changing the complex canopy depiction to 丷(丷), maintaining the concept of separation under an umbrella.
etymology.simplification: 𠈌(𠈌) was simplified to 丷(丷), removing the detailed depiction of people for a simpler, more abstract representation.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢用伞在雨中漫步(我喜歡用傘在雨中漫步)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān yòng sǎn zài yǔzhōng mànbù.
examples.english: I like to stroll in the rain with an umbrella.

examples.chinese: 暴风雨来临时(暴風雨來臨時)，伞可以保护我们(傘可以保護我們)。
examples.pinyin: Bàofēngyǔ láilín shí, sǎn kěyǐ bǎohù wǒmen.
examples.english: When a storm comes, an umbrella can protect us.

examples.chinese: 夏日阳光下(夏日陽光下)，一把伞带来清凉(一把傘帶來清涼)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàrì yángguāng xià, yī bǎ sǎn dàilái qīngliáng.
examples.english: Under the summer sunshine, an umbrella brings coolness.
